definition: propriety/appropriate behavior/proper speech or action/within the norms
part/share/ingredient/component

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
a unit of length/inch/thumb
inappropriate/bad-mannered

sentences.chinese: 人的本性是善良的，有分寸的。

sentences.english: A good actor must learn the art of tinting.
sentences.chinese: 要想当个好演员就要学会掌握道白的时间分寸。

sentences.english: In the performance - this recreation, the perception of propriety has the determining importance.
sentences.chinese: 分寸感在表演这种再度创作中具有决定的重要性。

sentences.english: You must be frank; but without indiscretion; and close, without being costive.
sentences.chinese: 你必须坦诚而不轻率，掌握分寸而不吝啬小气。

sentences.english: A sense of humour is a sense of proportion.
And China’s retaliation so far has been measured.
sentences.chinese: 至今，中国方面的报复行动也是有分寸的。

sentences.english: She may be a good artist, but she doesn't know where to draw the line.
sentences.chinese: 她也许是一位优秀的画家，但她不懂得掌握分寸。

sentences.english: A good actor must learn the art of timing, ie when to deliver a line most effectively.
sentences.chinese: 要想当个好演员就要学会掌握道白的时间分寸。

sentences.english: You are a workaholic, what kind of sense of proprietary do you have?
sentences.chinese: 你是个工作狂，你能有什么分寸？

sentences.english: Don't worry, I can handle that.
Most decent programmers seem to grasp the execution of their program as a single thread.
sentences.chinese: 大多数有分寸的程序员都掌握单线程应用程序的运行。

sentences.english: She has to have proper restraint, can't do this kind of silly matter.
sentences.chinese: 她要有分寸，就不会去做这种蠢事了。

sentences.english: Just have to control a proper restraint and a degree.
sentences.chinese: 只是得掌握一个分寸和一个度。

sentences.english: Babbitt paid his bill, said adequately .
sentences.chinese: 巴比特付了款，有分寸地说。

sentences.english: He rejoined the subject with sober jocularity.
sentences.chinese: 他以很有分寸的诙谐重新返回这个话题。

sentences.english: Finding the line between disapproval, pressure and continued engagement will be hard.
sentences.chinese: 在反对，施压，以及持续介入之间拿捏分寸是困难的。

definition: to grasp/(dialect) affecting shyness/coy/to create difficulties
to stop before going too far (idiom); to stop while one can/don't overdo it/stop while you're ahead
to handle affairs/to deal with
to touch on sth and leave it there/to take care not to overdo sth
one's own view/having definite opinions
to know the score (idiom)/to be well aware of the situation
reason/intellect/rationality/rational
to weigh up sb's words and observe their facial expression (idiom)/to discern what sb thinks from his body language
severity (of the case)/degree of seriousness/whether sth is slight or serious
to work/to handle matters/to have a job
to leave some leeway/to allow for the unpredictable
to let emotions affect one's decisions
knowing oneself (idiom)/self-knowledge
elegance (for men)/elegant demeanor/grace/poise
etiquette/(old) gradation of etiquette with social status
to understand/to know/to comprehend
